title: How to Insert a Running Head

steps.title: Type up your document before adding a running head.
steps.content: Type up your document before adding a running head. This can help ensure that your running head displays on every page of your document.

steps.title: Click on the “Insert” tab at the top of your document, then click on “Header.
steps.content: Click on the “Insert” tab at the top of your document, then click on “Header. ”

steps.title: Click on “Edit Header,” then type your header into the text field.
steps.content: Click on “Edit Header,” then type your header into the text field. The header you type will instantly display on all pages of your document.

steps.title: Press the “Tab” key twice or more as needed to reposition the cursor where you want page numbers displayed.
steps.content: Press the “Tab” key twice or more as needed to reposition the cursor where you want page numbers displayed.

steps.title: Click on “Page Number” at the top left corner of Microsoft Word, then select “Current Position.
steps.content: Click on “Page Number” at the top left corner of Microsoft Word, then select “Current Position. ”

steps.title: Choose the page number design you want added to your document, such as “Plain Number.
steps.content: Choose the page number design you want added to your document, such as “Plain Number. ” Your document will now display both the title and page number in the running head.

steps.title: Click on the red X on the far right of the header-and-footer design tab.
steps.content: Click on the red X on the far right of the header-and-footer design tab. The header-and-footer tab will close, and the running head you inserted will display on every page of your document. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Type up your document before adding a running head.
steps.content: Type up your document before adding a running head. This will help ensure that the running head displays on every page of your document.

steps.title: Click on “Insert” at the top of your document, then click on “Header.
steps.content: Click on “Insert” at the top of your document, then click on “Header. ” The cursor will automatically reposition itself in the header field.

steps.title: Type the text you want displayed in the running head.
steps.content: Type the text you want displayed in the running head. The text will instantly display on all pages of your document.

steps.title: Click on anywhere within the main document to save your header.
steps.content: Click on anywhere within the main document to save your header. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click on “Insert” again, then point to “Page number.
steps.content: Click on “Insert” again, then point to “Page number. ”

steps.title: Select the option to have page numbers displayed at the top right corner.
steps.content: Select the option to have page numbers displayed at the top right corner. Google Docs will automatically add page numbers to all pages in your document. [3] X Research source
